setting up complementary plant groups, managing cropping cycles for soil health, using plants naturally to ward off pests, and adopting an overall natural approach. Each of these areas has key sub-tasks that a viewer could follow to apply these methods. The final answer would list these as the MAINTASKs with their respective SUBTASKs.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Companion planting and crop rotation for healthy gardens
subtasks: Plant corn, beans, and squash in a Three Sisters setup (~10 min)
Position beans to grow up corn stalks (~5 min)
Grow squash around the plant base to cover the soil (~5 min)
Use marigolds around tomatoes and cucumbers as a natural pest repellent (~10 min)
Plant basil and dill near other crops to attract pollinators and deter pests (~15 min)
Rotate crops each year, e.g., beans following heavy nitrogen users (~10 min)
Plant cover crops like clover or rye in off-season (~15 min)
Understand the role of cover crops in protecting and enriching soil (~10 min)
Tiller cover crops into the soil as green manure (~10 min)
Learn about natural pest control methods (~30 min total)
Adopting the Three Sisters planting method (~30 min total)
Mastering crop rotation and cover cropping (~1 hour total)
